intro: Duhaldea wissmanniana, commonly known as the Wissmann's duhaldea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
